Question: The total number of points of local minimum and local maximum of the function $f(x)=\int_0^{x^2} \frac{t^2-5 t+4}{2+e^t} d t$ =?
Step1:
Notice $ {t^2 - 5t+4 = (t-4)(t-1)}$ and $
$use the property  i.e. $\\

$ If the function $f(x)$ and $g(x)$ are defined on $[a, b]$ and differentiable at all points$\\

x \in[a, b], \quad \text { then } \quad  {\frac{d}{d x}\left[\int_{f(x)}^{g(x)} h(t) d t\right]=h[g(x)] g^{\prime}(x)-h[f(x)] f^{\prime}(x)}\text{ to find $f'(x)$}.
$
$\\$
Step2: Set $f'(x) = 0$ to find all the critical points.
